attributes.action: Make vaccinations a requirement before a child can be enrolled in a school
attributes.background: At various stages throughout childhood, vaccines are administered to prevent fatal diseases that have killed millions of children in recorded history. They're vital to our survival and to those who cannot be immunised for medical reasons. Herd immunity only works if enough people are vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details: Earlier in 2017, the UK celebrated that measles had been eradicated in this country. This was hindered in the 90s by the work of (former Doctor) Andrew Wakefield. I accordance with WHO policy, 'eradicated' does not mean it was completely destroyed. It takes a 95% clearance to gain this status. There has, however, been a resurgence after the rise of the antivaxxer movement and foreign nationals entering the UK who carry such diseases. It takes one person to spread childhood disease.

attributes.action: Make the 16/30 free hours worth of childcare available to children from 6 months
attributes.background: The government offers 16 hours worth of free childcare when your child is two and either 15/30 free hours for children aged 3-4, what about free childcare for children younger than this for all the parents that want to work but will struggle to do so with the current fees for childcare?
attributes.additional_details: The current system is out dated and ridiculous.  There are plenty of families/single parents that want to go out to work when their child is a few months old but are unable to do so because of the crippling prices of childcare fees.  For this reason the government needs to start the free childcare entitlement age to 6+ months, so that every family that wants to go out and work can do so without working to just cover nursery fees.

attributes.action: Provide a FREE phone Universal Credit helpline
attributes.background: The Universal Credit Helpline for England and wales costs claimants 55p PER MINUTE to call.  This is an indefensible policy that puts much more pressure on already overstretched claimants calling the helpline to chase payments, chase delayed processing of claims and many other reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
On 11th Ocober 2017 during PMQ's Jeremy Corbyn asked the Prime Minister to provide a free phone helpline, however the PM decided NOT to respond to this particular question.
 
Universal Credit (UC) is supposed to be a benefit to help people into work and support them while they do so. Providing a helpline that is essentially a premium rate number for people that are already under financial pressure is indefensible and totally unfair and a free phone number should be provided as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Cap costs! People should not be forced to sell their homes to pay for care.
attributes.background: Last year as many as 50000 pensioners were forced to sell their home to pay for care. In a survey, two thirds of people said they believed social care care payments should be shared between them and the Government. But nine in 10 want a solid cap on contributions from individuals.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that there should be an overall maximum an individual should ever face paying and that the Government should introduce a cap on care costs. The average cost of a care home place is £600 a week. If anyone needing support has capital, including the value of any property, or income above £23250, it is likely they will be liable for care fees. People should not be forced to sell their home to pay for care. It is time to cap care costs!

attributes.action:
Windrush Day:June 22 celebrate our immigrant populations
contribution to the UK
attributes.background: The fight for a tolerant, ­respectful society goes on – and a Windrush Day would be the best answer to right wing extremists groups who believe that multiculturalism has failed and that Britain should to return to how it looked in 1950.
attributes.additional_details: We should choose 22 June, the day when the MV Empire Windrush docked at Tilbury in 1948: a powerful and iconic symbol of the rise of modern-day multicultural Britain. The Windrush is not simply a symbol of the 492 Caribbean men and women who arrived on that ship – the first big group of postwar immigrants from the West Indies – but of everyone who came from the Empire; British subjects who saw Britain as their mother country. The seeds of modern ­migration were sown in these former colonies, from which 2.5 million men and women ­volunteered to fight fascism ­during the second world war.

attributes.action: Allow recovery agents to have a different colour beacons while working
attributes.background: I believe recovery operatives should be allowed to have a different colour beacon on their vehicles and also be allowed to use flashing red/white lights on the rear of vehicle
attributes.additional_details: Due to there being no restrictions on who can use Orange beacons people no longer take notice of them, we are in effect an emergency service working in one of the most dangerous locations. We should be respected and allowed the same safety of any emergency service who works in a high risk location.

attributes.action: Make keeping primates as pets a criminal offence
attributes.background: Primates are the closest animal to us. They are incredibly intelligent creatures with many needs that simply cannot be met in a domestic environment. We would, of course, love to believe that people with a licence to keep a pet monkey would be aware of these needs, but sadly most are not.

attributes.action: Prevent any money being paid to the EU from Britain after March 2019.
attributes.background: Theresa May has no mandate to pay the EU after March 2019. Her mandate is only to give the block notice of leaving, then follow through on the procedure. The vote of the people must be respected in full.

attributes.action: Make not keeping receipts/basic accounts when you hold an LPA a criminal offence
attributes.background: Now, if you're entrusted with a vulnerable persons finances, a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) it is only suggested that you keep receipts/records/basic accounts to explain any purchases made. It should be a legal requirement to produce this if requested to help safeguard our vulnerable loved ones.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my father, Richard Nelson Scott, on 17/5/16. No one thinks that a family member will steal from their vulnerable, ill loved one but it happened to us. It's happening more now with our ageing population. Some get away with it by having an LPA. By amending current guidelines the LPA holder will have to produce records if a concerned person wants an investigation of financial affairs.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glitter and save our marine life!
attributes.background:
Tops Day Nurseries have made a pledge to become more sustainable and have recently discovered an unexpected item that has already had a detrimental effect on the environment… Glitter. 

Although much loved as an art and craft favourite, glitter is a microplastic, just like microbeads.
attributes.additional_details:
We already know that 100% of mussels found off France and Belgium have ingested microplastics and many fish have too; so if you eat shell fish you more than likely have eaten microplastics too, along with the toxic additives that manufacturers use which are known to copy oestrogen, and affect human fertility. 

As responsible people looking after the next generation, the last thing we want to do is damaging the environment or risking their health, so we need to act now and stop this pollution.

attributes.action: Tighter Regulations On Dog Breeding and Make Neutering and Spaying Compulsory
attributes.background: The country is awash with animals being dumped and abandoned, shelters are bursting at the seams. Healthy animals are being euthanised as there simply aren't enough homes available. Bitches are being bred repeatedly for financial gain. So called designer breeds were previously mongrels.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the rules states 2 KC registered litters per bitch, this can be overcome by registering extra females in a litter and using the extra papers on the original bitch.

There is no law regulating unscrupulous breeding.

1. Licence breeders, limiting the amount of breeding bitches per breeder, inspect regularly to maintain welfare and standards.
2. Spaying and neutering should be compulsory. Stop puppy farms and back yard breeders.
3. Tougher penalties for people in breach of the law.

attributes.action: Remove date of birth from the Companies House open register.
attributes.background:
Having recently been a victim of identity theft, it transpired they collected my contact details from the open Companies House register.

It appears easy to set up a credit account for online retailers using name, date of birth and address.

Leaving 3.9m company directors open to identity theft.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to petition the government to remove the date of birth field from the Companies House register in order to make it slightly harder for criminals to undertake simple identity theft such as this.

As cyber crime becomes more prevalent and larger businesses tighten their security, small and medium businesses (and their owners) will become an easier target.

attributes.action: People caught fly-tipping should have their vehicle(s) seized and crushed.
attributes.background: Fly-tipping is the illegal dumping of rubbish. It scars the landscape and costs millions to remove. I can't imagine anyone not being appalled at the level of fly-tipping in this country, apart from those who make money from the activity or those with no respect for their communities and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Expanded wording of the Petition -
In addition to fines payable for fly-tipping, those found guilty of fly-tipping should have the vehicle(s) they own or vehicle(s) knowingly provided to them for the purpose of fly-tipping, seized and crushed. Perpetrators hiring or borrowing vehicles for the purposes of fly-tipping will pay the equivalent cost of crushing and replacing the said vehicle in addition to any fines imposed for the offence.

attributes.action:
Impose legal regulations on the use of digitally altered images
in the media.
attributes.background:
This use of digitally altered images of persons in all broadcast & non-broadcast media should be more heavily regulated.

The only alterations to be permissible under law are elements that are temporary in nature (for example a blemish/bruise etc) and such alterations should be disclosed.
attributes.additional_details:
Any alterations that modify the size and proportion of a model should be prohibited.

This is to ensure that a model's physical appearance is not artificially manipulated, including their weight, shape and size. 

If such acts are carried out, the offending party should be awarded
with a large fine.

Photoshop should be used in a sophisticated manner, and images promoted to the public should encourage a realistic and healthy body image.

attributes.action: Health sec, Jeremy Hunt: waive all prescription charges for asthma medication.
attributes.background: Asthma is a manageable but incurable condition, which can last a lifetime.  Caused by inflammation of the bronchial passages, it can be continuous or spasmodic. Needless to say, both are unpleasant, and can at worst be life-threatening. Triggers include stress,animals, house dust,air quality,pollen.
attributes.additional_details: At present, many people are continually on 2 different types of medication for asthma - a reliever e.g.salbutamol, and a preventer/steroid inhaler e.g.seretide. In flare-ups, and in time of infection, anti-biotics may also be necessary. This petition is asking for inhalers, and other specific medication, to be provided (on prescription) free-of-charge to all patients needing it. It is my belief that in doing so, bed spaces in hospitals would be freed up as patients would be encouraged to manage their condition more effectively.Overall savings would be made.

attributes.action: Ban unsafe sleep products such as bumpers, sleep positioners and pillows
attributes.background: I lost a child due to SIDS and now want to spread awareness about the importance of safe sleep. New “sleep” products are hitting the market and new parents are fooled by their false claims. Using these products (sleep positioners, pillows, bumpers) can increase the risk of suffocation.
attributes.additional_details: There is sufficient evidence that babies have died as a consequence of using these products. They shouldn’t be allowed to be sold in the UK. There has been 2 infant deaths related to baby hammocks yet they are still sold. There have been cot bumper related deaths and they are banned in certain states in America . New studies show sleep positioners to be unsafe. Baby pods and nests should carry a warning that they are not safe for overnight sleep.

attributes.action: Allow adult British citizens the right to choose doctor-assisted suicide
attributes.background: Adults should have the right to choose authorised-doctor-assisted suicide in Britain, protected by legal safeguards established in consultation with interested parties, including mental health professionals and disability organisations.
attributes.additional_details: The legal rights to make end of life choices, such as putting a Do Not Attempt Resuscitation order in a Living Will, and to dignity already exist. Assisted suicide is legal in 5 European countries, Canada and several states in America. It is available to British citizens who are able to travel to the Swiss clinic Dignitas and are capable of receiving, and can afford to pay for, its services. It is not currently legal in Britain.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for energy companies to levy a standing charge for smart meters.
attributes.background: Upon leaving my gas meter inactive for three months as I waited for my landlord to sort out the safety inspection (and not needing heating in the meantime) I was surprised to find that I was in arrears by approximately £26 Pounds due to British Gas charging a daily fee of £0.278 regardless of usage.
attributes.additional_details: Upon further investigation I found out that the "Big Six" energy companies charge over £100 per year before your top ups actually allow you to have hot water and heat your house using gas. This means that vulnerable people will experience fuel poverty even if they conserve gas by not using it. After just £5 Pounds of arrears, the meter turns off. In 2015, 9000 British people died from cold homes according to University College London. Making this "no use tax" illegal will therefore save lives.

attributes.action: Abolish tuition fees
attributes.background: Charging students for a near-essential requirement for future employment is discouraging even the best and brightest students from furthering their education and achieving their full potential, leaving students in £36,000+ of debt before even starting work. Education is a right, not a privilege.
attributes.additional_details: With more people attending university than ever before and it becoming more and more necessary in order to succeed in the world of work, our young people are being left saddled by huge financial burdens that can often lead to anxiety among students. In modern Britain education should be a right and not just a privilege for those who can afford it. Even with measures which attempt to relieve this burden, the problems created by this debt can only be resolved in one way: abolishing them entirely.

attributes.action: Reject any proposals to merge Christchurch with Bournemouth and Poole council
attributes.background: 84% of Christchurch already voted AGAINST the merge with Bournemouth and Poole in the recent postal vote.
attributes.additional_details:
negociations are still happening on weather to ignore the voters and merge anyway... Christchurch is my home town, and we voted, so our vote and our voices matter. if our vote is ignored then why even vote in the first place? 
The people of Christchurch have decided that we do NOT want to be merged with Bournemouth and Poole so sign this petition if you would like the Government and Parliament to reject any proposals that the councils be merged. Thank you.

attributes.action: Introduce a 5p tax on all disposable takeaway cups.
attributes.background: The UK uses approximately 2.5 billion takeaway cups a year. Most are un-recyclable. This is a huge amount of waste. The 5p bag tax reduced carrier bag use by 85%, from 7 billion to 500 million a year. Introducing a similar tax for disposable cups would reduce another source of waste.

attributes.action: Urge football associations to boycott the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar.
attributes.background: The FIFA World Cup 2022 is to be held in Qatar. In preparing for the tournament, the state of Qatar has committed appalling human rights violations, as exposed by organisations including Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International. The UK's national football teams cannot be allowed to compete.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.hrw.org/news/2017/09/27/qatar-take-urgent-action-protect-construction-workers

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/campaigns/2016/03/qatar-world-cup-of-shame/

Reports such as these illustrate the scale and shocking nature of human rights abuses sponsored by FIFA in Qatar. It would make a mockery of the UK's commitment to human rights and international law to turn a blind eye to such flagrant violations. It is time to say enough is enough: football and profits cannot trump humanity.

attributes.action: Make Animal Tested products more easily identifiable.
attributes.background:
The consumer should be able to easily identify products that are linked to animal cruelty so they do not purchase them unwittingly.
Stop Animal Cruelty Now!

attributes.action: Change the law on gazumping
attributes.background: When an offer is accepted on a property it should be legally binding and gazumping should be illegal.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory from the age of 18
attributes.background: The turnouts for general elections are extremely low. On average only 60% of registered voters actually take part. The remaining 40% remain passive despite the fact that they're UK citizens and the outcome greatly affects not only them, but their family and friends.
attributes.additional_details: During the 2010 general elections the total UK citizens that voted amounted to just 65% . This shows that a significant amount of potential voters did not take part. The remaining 16 million registered could've hugely impacted the end result if they'd only bothered to vote.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background:
The House of Lords is meant to be a revising chamber for Government legislation. It is currently bursting at the seams with unelected peers who claim expenses and do not vote. 115 peers claimed £1.3m in expenses but scarcely uttered a word or voted.
Replace the House with an elected upper chamber.
attributes.additional_details:
It is time for elections to the House of Lords.
Elect people from different backgrounds and experience to represent the people and truly hold Parliament to account.

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on motorways from 70mph to 80mph by 2022.
attributes.background: Speed limits on motorways need updating and speed cameras while there to provide a critically important deterrent stop drivers from going faster on a clear stretch of road. By increasing the speed limit on our motorways drivers would legally reduce travel time and make road travel more productive.

attributes.action: Don't close Parliamentary Petition system in the months surrounding an election
attributes.background:
Before and during the 2017 general election the Parliamentary Petition site closed. It was not reinstated until September, resulting in four months when citizens were denied a mechanism for raising concerns.

There is no reason why the mechanism for submitting or signing petitions should be closed
attributes.additional_details: Separate the running of the petitions site from the reviewing of petitions. The first should be available to citizens at all times (with the possible exception of during the actual election campaign), the second is reasonably the role of the petitions committee.

attributes.action: To ensure volunteers who dress up for charity organisations have DBS checks
attributes.background: Organisations (non-profit) who do charity events are not as yet required by law to give members DBS checks
attributes.additional_details: At the moment any sex offenders even if they are on the sex offenders registry are allowed to dress in costume concealing their identity and carry out non-profit charity work even at events where children could be present and interacted with without any DBS checks. I would like a law to be passed to make such organisations responsible to carry out DBS checks on any present and new members by law

attributes.action: Abolish the role of the Mayor of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough
attributes.background:
We the people of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough simply wish for the role of Mayor of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough to be abolished.

The hard working tax-payers of the above said, do not wish to fund a Mayor and a Mayors office in all its entirety...

attributes.action: Strobe Light Warnings to be a Legal Requirement
attributes.background: For establishments using strobe lights, or for companies utilising a building in which they will issue strobe lights, there should be a legal requirement for both parties to issue a strobe light warning on both the physical establishment and on the respective website clearly.

attributes.action: Bring back the nit nurse!
attributes.background: Its just been the summer holidays and some children have returned to school with head lice. Children as young as 4 and 5 are riddled with them. That cannot be comfortable in the slightest! If we brought back the nit nurse then i think it would benefit alot of kids and destroy the nasty critters!

attributes.action: Revise to Abortion Act to allow women to take medical abortion pills at home.
attributes.background: Currently, women are required to take abortion pills at a medical clinic due to the outdated Abortion Act of 1967. This means that women often begin the painful process in public or whilst travelling. This could be easily avoided if the Act was amended to allow women to take the pills at home.
attributes.additional_details: The Abortion Act of 1967 states that any abortion must take place in a medical clinic. Since this Act was passed, medical abortions have become possible, and now make up 2/3 of abortions. Due to the Act, women have to travel to a clinic twice within 48 hours. It is not medically necessary to take these pills in a clinic, this is simply enforced as a due to the strict terms of the 1967 Act. Consequently, many women unnecessarily begin this painful process in public or whilst travelling.

attributes.action: Provide tuition fee loans for all graduate medical students
attributes.background: The Government does not offer tuition fee loans for graduates studying a 5-year medical degree. This leaves graduate medical students having to decide between crippling debt or dropping out of their studies. Tuition fee loans would enable selection of students based on merit and not ability to pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Graduates bring valuable life experience to the medical profession but are currently being hindered from completing a medical degree due to the significant burden of paying £9250 per year in fees upfront without the option of a tuition fee loan.

The Government already offer tuition fee loans to those studying medicine as a first degree. However, in light of the chronic doctor shortages in the NHS, the Government should extend this support for studying undergraduate medicine as second degree.

attributes.action: UK Government make it compulsory for manufacturers of salt in UK to add iodine.
attributes.background: Iodine deficiency is linked to miscarriage,stillbirth,mental impairment,increase of perinatal and infant mortality. It is the most common worldwide cause of thyroid disorders. Low iodine can cause hypothyroidism,goitre and can affect fertility,pregnancy and neurodevelopmental disorders in new-borns
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mark Vanderpump, told the Society for Endocrinology 'Data suggests the UK is iodine deficient’ A study involving 700 teenage girls at nine UK centres found more than two thirds had an iodine deficiency and nearly a fifth showed very low iodine levels.
http://astutehealthcare.co.uk/iodine-aqua/pdf/2011-bbcnews-Worrying-levels-of-iodine-deficiency-in-the-uk.pdf
http://www.who.int/nutrition/topics/idd/en/
http://www.ukiodine.org/professor-john-lazarus/
http://theiodineproject.m.webs.com/

attributes.action: Tackle corporate tax-dodging – Make the UK a participant in CCCTB
attributes.background: Tax-dodging by companies like Apple and Google is a huge problem in the UK. The proposal for a 'Common Consolidated Corporate Tax Base' (CCCTB) by the European Commission would change the rules to stop this. Whatever our views on EU membership, this needs to be included in the final Brexit deal.
attributes.additional_details: As an example of the current system, Apple in 2014 paid just £12 million in UK tax on UK profits of £2 billion. To do this, 'Apple UK' pays its profits to 'Apple Ireland', where it can pay less than 4% corporate tax. CCCTB would change tax rules so that companies be charged based on where their activity be done – meaning that a company with sales, employment and assets (say, 20% of its European total) in the UK would have to pay UK tax on 20% of its European profits; a far fairer system.

attributes.action: End fines for parents who take their children on short holiday during term time.
attributes.background:
Since 2013 parents can be subject to criminal proceedings for taking their children on holiday during term times.

The current system exploits the law that was passed under the guise of dealing with repeated truancy. It is also indirectly discriminating against families based on class and income.
attributes.additional_details:
Two scientists (Dr. Beccy Smith and Alan Barr) have investigated the figures, separating the data for authorised term-time holidays from the broader dataset used by the government, which includes other absences such as those related to illness or exclusion.

They have concluded, independently, that authorised holiday absences are not linked to poorer attainment at KS2, and there is growing evidence to suggest this is the case across the stages.

attributes.action: Teach life skills to students in secondary schools, e.g. managing money etc.
attributes.background: Our education system should be designed to equip school leavers for the world of work and beyond. Yet there are still many young people who don’t possess essential life skills including managing money, employment skills, managing mental health, LGBT inclusive sex education, first aid etc.

attributes.action: Law to reward public if they get proof of a driver illegally using mobile phone.
attributes.background: Police can't be everywhere to catch drivers who use their mobile phones whilst driving. This law rewards the public if they get irefutable video or photo evidence of the driver using a mobile while driving. The reward will be a proportion of the fine after successful prosecution.
attributes.additional_details: This would empower the public whilst detering potential offending drivers. Nobody would dare touch their phone while driving if they thought the person walking their dog, standing at the bus stop, cyclist with a helmet camera etc was watching and waiting for them to touch their phone. Evidence would be presented with a time, date and place to be admissable to the authorities with vehicle model, registration and driver clearly using their phone in a manner contravening current UK laws.

attributes.action: Make cyclists display number plates. They are road users as well.
attributes.background: Cyclists seem to think they are above the law. They should be registered and display a number plate so they can be identified.
attributes.additional_details: I have constantly witnessed them ignoring red lights and not giving way at junctions. If they were to be the cause of and accident they can ride away without being identified.

attributes.action: Change the law on selling houses in the UK, in favour of protecting the vendors.
attributes.background:
Protect vendors from incomplete sales & costs being incurred. 
Although close to my heart, I am confident this is a UK wide issue & I propose we
introduce deposits, or purchasers accountability/liability, to protect & pay (for example) vendor solicitor fees. 
Make house selling/buying achievable.
attributes.additional_details:
Twice our house sale has fallen through and fees have been incurred due to the buyers ‘change of circumstance’. In these instances or similar, such fees should not be the responsibility of the vendor.

When you wish to buy a house, you should be committed to buying that house and as such (and similar to other countries) deposits should be paid. Additionally, any vendor solicitor fees (or any other costs) where buyers renage on their decision, should be solely the purchasers accountability.

attributes.action: Change the law to make it compulsory for all taxis to be fitted with CCTV
attributes.background: Shops, bars, hospitals, and the majority of public places are fitted with CCTV to maintain public safety.  Introducing cameras into taxis would promote the safety of both the general public and the driver, and decrease the risk of assault, abuse and theft.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics from the Metropolitan Police Service have revealed 126 taxi or private hire drivers were charged with violent or sexual offences in 2015. Furthermore 6 separate councils in the North West of England have granted or renewed permits for more than 300 convicted drivers since 2012. Within these approvals are those committed of sexual offences, indecent exposure, drug dealing, violence and harassment, possession of a fire arm, theft, burglary and criminal damage. This figures show that there needs to be further restrictions, and increased monitoring in place. 
 
The privacy of both parties would still be maintained, as conversations would not be recorded, and devices could be deactivated when the driver is not working.

attributes.action: Make the use of inhumane cat deterrents a criminal offence
attributes.background: As a cat owner, I was shocked when my neighbour placed a row of over thirty rusty, three inch nails along the fence dividing our gardens. I rang the police, the council and the housing association to be told there was nothing i could do as he owns the fence. Both households have children and pets.
attributes.additional_details: Any sort of spikes or jagged projections including any made aggressive topping or addition to a wall or fence including carpet gripper, broken glass and nails that are a danger to humans or animals should be illegal. We should not have to live in fear of our family members (Including pets) being harmed in our own homes. Currently it is only an offence if the fence is on land adjoining a public highway, not a home.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis Patches to be prescribed on the NHS for Chronic Pain conditions
attributes.background: Cannabis Patches should be prescribed on the NHS. It’s safer and cheaper than drugs currently used such as Morphine and Fentanyl.
attributes.additional_details:
I have many Chronic Pain conditions. I have been taking controlled drugs for over 12 years such as Morphine, Fentanyl, Oramorph and Tramadol ALL this could be avoided if I could have ONE Cannabis patch.  What I take is far more addictive and costs much more than a Cannabis Patch. It’s time we had Cannabis Patches made available on the NHS.
https://fibromyalgianewstoday.com/2017/06/23/first-cannabinoid-based-patch-for-fibromyalgia-other-chronic-pain-is-ready-for-release/

attributes.action: Allow Tyler the Creator back into the UK
attributes.background:
Tyler, The Creator claims he has been banned from the UK.
The US rapper says he is not allowed to enter the country for "three to five years" because of lyrics he wrote in 2009.
The co-founder of hip-hop collective Odd Future has always attracted controversy.
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship, or societal sanction. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used. This right has been incorporated into the Human Rights Act in 1998 and is still used today.

attributes.action: Reduce 20% VAT on bottled water to zero in line with proposed sugar tax
attributes.background: With obesity reaching epidemic levels, how can it make sense to tax something healthy like bottled water while cake is zero rated for VAT ?
attributes.additional_details: Replace the reduction in VAT on bottled water by taxing cake instead

attributes.action: Police required by law to pursue suspects not wearing a helmet
attributes.background: Every day there is more and more crime on motorbikes/mopeds etc. If the people riding them aren’t wearing a helmet, they know that the police cannot pursue them. They are laughing and getting away with it. Enough is enough. If they're big enough to do the crime, they're big enough to take the risk.

attributes.action: Make pet owners responsibility for their pet’s microchip details when rehoming
attributes.background: If an owner has to rehome their dog or cat it should be partly their responsibility to notify their microchip provider that the pet has been rehomed and send them the new owners details. Similar to V5 for a car where both the new and old owners have to notify the DVLA. If not a fine can be issued
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be better laws in place to make it the responsibility of BOTH the old and new owners to update the animals microchip details.
Based on figures from the Dogs Trust Up to 12 dogs a day face being Put to Sleep because their owners haven’t updated their dogs microchip details 
And a further study conducted by Dogs Trust has found a mere 9% of dog owners consider updating their dogs’ microchips post-move a priority, with sorting digital TV coming above this.

attributes.action: Make Zebra crossings safer for Pedestrians
attributes.background:
My Dad, a 91 year old Father of 5 Children, 16 Grandchildren and 7 Great Grandchildren was knocked down and killed whilst crossing the Road at a Zebra Crossing. 

Govt should look at position/ suitability of crossings ensuring that a pedestrian crossing is the safest place for people to cross
attributes.additional_details:
At the Old Bailey, the Driver was acquitted of causing 'death by careless driving'. Emphasis was placed on our Dad not paying attention when crossing at the Zebra crossing rather than the Driver of the Car being careless. 

We feel:

Zebra Crossings on main Roads, near Schools and junctions be changed to Pelican Crossings

The Highway Code needs to be changed to give pedestrians greater priority at crossings

The distance of a crossing from a junction should be standardised to at least 8 metres

attributes.action: Prohibit the release of pheasants into the countryside for shooting
attributes.background: Every year approximately 35,000,000 pheasants are released into the countryside to be shot for sport. They are often intensively reared and little able to cope in the wild, with many killed by cars.This non-native species also causes massive damage to crops and gardens. This practice needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Most pheasants in the UK have not reproduced in the wild but have been released. 25% of those bred in captivity die before the shooting season even begins. Many birds are wounded when shot and not killed outright. They are hugely destructive, causing damage costing thousands of pounds. On compassionate and environmental grounds, their release should be prohibited.
https://www.gwct.org.uk/research/species/birds/common-pheasant/
http://robyorke.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/gamebird-release.pdf
